heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 20 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (180°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 51.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.7 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.7 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) and cloud levels (up 583 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 182.8m higher than yesterday, 275.0m lower than the past week, 583.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 642m and a high of 993m, averaging 937.7m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air moisture should feel ok and calm and still conditions are expected. Chance of light rain, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and periods of sunshine are expected. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
